DVB-S

what i should looking  for   ?
in your dmesg, look for one of two things. Look for Connexant or video0 (could be video with another number also).

one suggestion that I have is to check http://www.linuxtv.org and search through their documentation (also search their mailing list archives). It *should* work, as it's using a Connexant chip (which is used in Hauppauge cards also), but that's not a guarantee.
this might get you closer http://www.linuxtv.org/wiki/index.php/Cx88_devices_(cx2388x)
it might just be that no one has tested the card with the linuxtv subsystem.
that's because they haven't created a driver for it yet. Or they haven't put it into the cardlist yet.
try 86 It has the same device id as your card.
Your best bet is to subscribe to the linux-media mailing list, and ask there. They'll know whether your card works with linux or not (and how to specify the card= for it, if it does).
the link to subscribe will be on the linuxtv.org site I gave you earlier.
I'd say the second one looks right. Or it might need a space between insmod and card. I'll look for the right syntax.

to verify this, put lspci -vnn into the terminal, and just paste the line that shows the name of the card. It'll  have "05:01.0 Multimedia video controller: Conexant Systems, Inc. CX23880/1/2/3 PCI Video and Audio Decoder (rev 05)" in it
Specifically the last portion [xxxx:xxxx]
you're going to need to ask on the mailing list (linuxtv.org). Give them that information, along with whatever is underneath it.

you'll get to that point before you know it. The only reason I know anything about their list is I've been trying to get a USB TV Tuner working for a couple of years now. It works, but the code isn't styled right, so they won't include it.
